newsitem.title: FRANCE: Soros firms acquire 5.5 pct of Moulinex.
newsitem.headline: Soros firms acquire 5.5 pct of Moulinex.

text.p: Firms controlled by Hungarian-born investor and speculator George Soros have acquired 5.48 percent of the troubled French appliance manufacturer Moulinex, the French stockmarkets association SBF said on Wednesday.

It said the three firms, Quantum Partners LDC, Geosor Corp and Lupa Family Partners LP, declared they had bought 5.39 percent, 0.05 percent and 0.04 percent, respectively, of Moulinex's capital "in concert" on November 12.
The stake represents 1.55 million Moulinex shares and 4.39 percent of the voting rights, the SBF said.
Moulinex announced a major restructuring with heavy layoffs in June after reporting a fourth consecutive annual loss.

The move was announced by chairman Pierre Blayau, installed earlier this year by the group's biggest shareholder, Euris, which was reported to be impatient with the recovery pace under the previous management.
Analysts blame Moulinex's troubles on high labour costs, an inefficient industrial structure and a dated product line.
